page.title: 17Birdlife in Inchnadamph
page.content: {80 species}are{resident here.}Of the birds of prey,the{merlins, kestrels, {buzzards and harriers}are common. {Peregrine falcons nest}in a secret place!{Ospreys}dive for salmon on the lochs.We get 2 different{eagles;}the golden and (very rarely) the{white- {tailed which is bigger.}Local game birds are{ptarmigan and grouse. Oyster {catchers}nest on stones beside lochs. Other common birds include{lapwings (nesting on Kirkton park){curlews, {ring_plovers,dippers(on the Tralligal) {greenshanks}(only nests here){golden {plovers,ring ouzels and meadow pipits. About 4 pairs of{house martins}nest in the eaves of the lodge. We get{red {throated divers}that nest on the lochs but feed at sea.The{black throated {diver}favours the bigger lochs where it feeds on trout.{Sandpipers, gulls and{ducks}also frequent Loch Assynt.
